summary: The report discusses the financial condition and operations of a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company focusing on the development and commercialization of therapies for cardiopulmonary diseases. Their lead product candidate is bentracimab, a reversal agent for the antiplatelet drug ticagrelor. The company is also developing pemziviptadil for the treatment of pulmonary arterial hypertension and PB6440 for treatment-resistant hypertension. The company has incurred significant operating losses and has funded its operations through equity and debt financing. They have entered into various license agreements and collaboration partnerships to support the development and commercialization of their product candidates. The report presents a detailed analysis of revenue, operating expenses, and other financial aspects for the years ended December 31, 2020, and 2019.
